Zucchini and bell peppers are a match made in heaven! 

A simple vinaigrette is all you need to bring everything together. Here are a few options that will complement the herby chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese, and roasted vegetables:

1. **Classic Italian Vinaigrette**: Whisk together 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. This vinaigrette is a timeless choice that will enhance the flavors of the salad without overpowering them.
2. **Herby Vinaigrette**: Combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil, salt, and pepper. This vinaigrette will tie in nicely with the herby flavors of the chicken and add a bright, refreshing touch to the salad.
3. **Lemon-Herb Vinaigrette**: Whisk together 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley, salt, and pepper. This vinaigrette will add a nice brightness and a hint of citrus to the salad, cutting through the richness of the goat cheese.

Feel free to adjust the proportions to your taste, and don't hesitate to add a pinch of sugar or honey if you prefer a sweeter vinaigrette.

Remember, the key is to keep the vinaigrette simple and let the flavors of the ingredients shine. You've got a delicious combination going on, and a light, refreshing vinaigrette will bring everything together beautifully!

Which vinaigrette option sounds most appealing to you, or do you have another favorite?
